display_title.display_title:
The Education Development
            Capacity Building Project for Cameroon will assist the
            Government with immediate educational challenges, in
            particular, by improving the relevance of the secondary and
            higher education systems. While the project's main
            focus is on enhanced education management, and on improved
            quality of education and capacity building, construction of
            educational facilities may pose environmental adversity. To
            this end, this environmental assessment proposes mitigation
            measures as follows. To control soil erosion, drainage
            systems should be shored up, redirecting rainfall and
            surface waters towards their natural river banks.
            Contractors shall be responsible for the installation of
            protective barriers around the construction perimeter, to
            minimize noise disturbances and ensure safety, in addition
            to conducting adequate cleaning of hazardous materials (oil
            spills, lubricants, etc.) in compliance with environmental
            regulations. Sanitary installations will be enforced to
            provide appropriate hygiene. Accordingly, toilets and plans
            for waste collection shall be taken into account, and
            adequate standards to prevent environmental impacts on
            water, land, air, and human health should be met. As an
            example, effluent discharge, wastewater discharge, and solid
            waste discharge will be managed in accordance with local
            regulations. (Vol. 2) : Plan de gestion environnementale du
            projet de réhabilitation de bâtiments à usage de salles de classe
